Job Title: Estimator

Location: United States

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Management, Manufacturing

Description:
About the Role:As an Estimator at DCS, you'll help our teams achieve our project objectives by developing internal cost estimates and requesting bids from suppliers. You'll anticipate specific requirements for new projects and ensure our bid strategy supports our budget requirements. You'll be a valuable member of our team, developing and maintaining strong partnerships with vendors and subcontractors and making sure we understand their abilities and capacity to perform work for us. We’ll appreciate your solutions-oriented approach, your estimating know-how, your impressive relationship-building, communication, and teamwork skills, and the way we can count on you to get things done - and get them done well. Sound like you? Apply now. 
In this role, you will…Support Pre-Contract and Operations with project costs and pricing objectivesUtilize past experience, data analysis, and metrics to develop mechanical installation estimates.Utilize tools and data analysis to create bid comparisons.Build and develop vendor relations and strategies.Select appropriate vendors for bidding various needs in concert with internal teams. Develop RFQ documentation for vendors and suppliers.Develop budgetary cost models.Assist in submission of bid projects.Build tools necessary for efficient estimating.Present budgetary cost models to internal operations teams and leaders.Maintain organized and accurate documentation throughout the project.Partner with Applications engineering and Purchasing to meet specific needs and scope of each job bid.
We’re excited about you because…You believe anything worth doing is worth doing right, no matter how “small”.You live in the details.You have the motivation and ability to learn and improve processes and tools.You enjoy a fast pace environment and having multiple projects to work on concurrently.You communicate clearly and concisely in both written and verbal form. You have strong Microsoft Excel skills and are comfortable developing new forms and tools.You are proficient in MS Office, including Word, Outlook, and PowerPoint.You have a minimum of 3 to 5 years of relevant experience (Material Handling Industry preferred) and a college degree (Bachelor’s in Finance, Accounting, or Engineering preferred) or equivalent experience.You are familiar with conveyor installation and have experience with estimating mechanical installation costs.You have experience or are ready to learn Sage Intacct ERP and ProCore Project Management Software.   About Us:  Conveyor may be in our name, but it’s only part of what we do. DCS was founded in 1982 and has grown to serve major clients in multiple industries by providing material handling, full-scale warehouse operations and conveyor design solutions that are custom crafted for their need. We don’t sell ready-made systems - we build relationships that empower us to craft custom solutions together. It’s the teamwork approach, sharing ideas and building upon them, that produces the best results. And DCS is committed to creating an extraordinary employment experience for our team. We work like crazy to hire and develop great people, build relationships, and ensure that the programs and services we offer our team are among the best in the business- from a killer snack wall and casual work environment to flexible PTO and opportunities to give back within the community.   More reasons to join our team:  We pride ourselves in our family-like culture and casual, but focused, work environment We offer competitive salaries and health benefits Our 401K program includes a 100% match up to 5% Participation in our Discretionary Profit-Sharing Program We offer our employees flexibility and autonomy We do community outreach projects throughout the year We know how to throw company events We work hard, but we also know how to have fun - darts, anyone?   Individuals seeking employment at Designed Conveyor Systems are considered without regards to race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, marital status, ancestry, physical or mental disability, veteran status, gender identity, or sexual orientation. Accommodation is available to applicants with a disability condition, when applying, testing, or interviewing for a position. Please let us know if you need accommodation.

Experience Level (if available): None
